operations.target_text: Guest Network Access: Visitors to the Company can access guest networks by registering with the office personnel, bypassing the need for a formal access request.
operations.comment: You indicated that you have an office, so guest network access section should be maintained. Having an office requires controlled network access for visitors to maintain security.

You indicated you use GitHub and BitBucket for version control, so this section should be maintained to protect source code access. Using version control systems requires proper IP protection measures.
You indicated you don't use any password management tool, so this section should be removed. No password management system = no need for specific password management policy section.

operations.target_text: All requests will be sent by email to <email>
operations.replacement: All requests will be submitted through the ticketing system (Trello/Jira)
operations.comment: You indicated you use Trello and Jira for ticket management and prefer using ticketing systems for access requests. Ticketing system provides proper audit trails and structured workflow compared to email-based requests.

You selected annual review frequency instead of quarterly basis. While quarterly reviews are recommended for most companies, annual reviews can be sufficient depending on your risk profile and compliance requirements. Ensure you consistently follow whatever schedule you document here.

You selected 1 week for access termination timeframe. While 24 hours is recommended for most companies, ensure this longer timeframe is justified by your operational needs. Note that timeframes longer than 1 week may raise concerns during audits.

You indicated that benni.mueller@consultex.de is the owner of this access control policy. This person will be responsible for enforcing the policy and answering any policy-related questions from employees.

You indicated that the Head of IT is responsible for approving exceptions to this policy. This role is appropriate for exception handling and should be consistently applied across all exception requests.
You indicated that the Head of IT is responsible for handling policy violations. This aligns with the exception approval authority and provides clear escalation path for policy violations.
